metadata.title: CVE-2021-4135 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A memory leak vulnerability was found in the Linux kernel's eBPF for theSimulated networking device driver in the way user uses BPF for the devicesuch that function nsim_map_alloc_elem being called. A local user could usethis flaw to get unauthorized access to some data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4135` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:
